intro: Chamaecytisus frivaldszkyanus, commonly known as the Frivaldszky's broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, characterized by its dense, thorny stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring, which are clustered in racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is well adapted to the harsh, arid conditions of its native habitat, showcasing resilience to drought and salt spray. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
